gov.nasa.arc.mct.registry
Class ExternalComponentRegistryImpl

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.registry.ExternalComponentRegistryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentRegistry, CoreComponentRegistry
public class ExternalComponentRegistryImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements CoreComponentRegistry

Provide an instance of the component registry which supports creating components. A singleton pattern is used to give access to a single instance of the registry. This class is not intended to be used by component developers and will be removed from the public API.

Nested Class Summary
static class ExternalComponentRegistryImpl.ExtendedComponentProvider
          Implements an extended component provider that can wrap a component provider supplied by a plugin bundle.
static class ExternalComponentRegistryImpl.ExtendedComponentTypeInfo
          Implements an extended component type information.

getDefaultUser

protected java.lang.String getDefaultUser()
Gets the user ID of the default owning user when creating components. This is currently the ID of the currently logged-in user.

Returns:
the default user ID

setDefaultViewProvider

public void setDefaultViewProvider(ComponentProvider provider)
Sets the default component provider that is used when looking up compatible view roles. Should be called by the framework only.

Parameters:
provider - the new provider to use

Description copied from interface: ComponentRegistry
Creates a new collection that contains components under the Created By Me component.

Returns:

newInstance

public <T extends AbstractComponent> T newInstance(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass,
                                                   AbstractComponent parent)
Description copied from interface: ComponentRegistry
Create a new instance of the specified component class. Components must be initialized with the MCT framework, so this method must be used when creating instances of components. Failure to do this will result in components which are not fully initialized and the system behavior when using these components is undefined.

Specified by:
newInstance in interface ComponentRegistry
Type Parameters:
T - specific base component type to create
Parameters:
componentClass - used to identify a component.
parent - to add newly created instance to. This value can be null which signifies that this will only show up under the created by me area.
Returns:
a new component instance or null if there is no component matching the given componentClass

refreshComponents

public void refreshComponents(java.util.List<ExternalComponentRegistryImpl.ExtendedComponentProvider> providers)
Refresh the set of components maintained by the registry. First, all component types are forgotten. Then, all component type providers are queried to get their component type information.

Parameters:
providers - the ordered list of component type providers

getComponent

public AbstractComponent getComponent(java.lang.String id)
Description copied from interface: ComponentRegistry
Get the component based on the component id.

Specified by:
getComponent in interface ComponentRegistry
Parameters:
id - the component id
Returns:
the component object

isCreatable

public boolean isCreatable(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
This method checks if the class can be created. If the class is creatable, it will appear under the "Create" menu.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to check if it is creatable.
Returns:
true if clazz is creatable, false otherwise

newInstance

public AbstractComponent newInstance(java.lang.String componentType)
Description copied from interface: CoreComponentRegistry
Create a new instance of the specified componentType. This API should only be used with the platform as this is only intended as a substitute for Class.forName.

Specified by:
newInstance in interface CoreComponentRegistry
Parameters:
componentType - to create new instance of
Returns:
uninitialized instance of the component type or null if the type doesn't exist.
